channel.title: Please answer these noob questions..I really need some help here
channel.description:
please dont flame at me for these noob questions... if u can help me then PLZ reply...If not..with all do respect..plz dont..THX!
1) i dont know if it is the client or not but does anyone know how to fix the GFX.. whenever i attack a dragon on Project16 source using moparscape client the GFX of the dragon get screwed up..any1 know how to fix? [img]http://motk.2dgamepro.com/untitled.bmp[/img]
2)after compiling do i need t decompile to edit the client.java inorder for it to work??? if so plz tell me how..

item.title: Please answer these noob questions..I really need some help here

item.title: Please answer these noob questions..I really need some help here
item.dc:creator: @pmgz_wannab pmgz wannab
item.description:
@pmgz_wannab wrote:

[quote=“i_puzzle_i, post:15, topic:40890”]Don’t quote me on this , but I thought you could assign the emote or GFX through the source code.
Like in NPCHandler. Heres a snippet from mine.

} else if (npcs[i].IsDead == true) { if (npcs[i].actionTimer == 0 && npcs[i].DeadApply == false && npcs[i].NeedRespawn == false) { if (npcs[i].npcType == 81 || npcs[i].npcType == 397 || npcs[i].npcType == 1766 || npcs[i].npcType == 1767 || npcs[i].npcType == 1768) { npcs[i].animNumber = 0x03E; //cow dead } else if (npcs[i].npcType == 41) { npcs[i].animNumber = 0x039; //chicken dead } else if (npcs[i].npcType == 87) { npcs[i].animNumber = 0x08D; //rat fucked up}

So wouldnt you just find the emote or GFX, whichever your looking for, and add a couple lines of code in your NPCHandler, Rather then the client? :|[/quote]lol

Read full topic
item.source: Please answer these noob questions..I really need some help here

item.title: Please answer these noob questions..I really need some help here
item.dc:creator: @i_puzzle_i i_puzzle_i
item.description:
@i_puzzle_i wrote:

Don’t quote me on this , but I thought you could assign the emote or GFX through the source code.
Like in NPCHandler. Heres a snippet from mine.

} else if (npcs[i].IsDead == true) { if (npcs[i].actionTimer == 0 && npcs[i].DeadApply == false && npcs[i].NeedRespawn == false) { if (npcs[i].npcType == 81 || npcs[i].npcType == 397 || npcs[i].npcType == 1766 || npcs[i].npcType == 1767 || npcs[i].npcType == 1768) { npcs[i].animNumber = 0x03E; //cow dead } else if (npcs[i].npcType == 41) { npcs[i].animNumber = 0x039; //chicken dead } else if (npcs[i].npcType == 87) { npcs[i].animNumber = 0x08D; //rat dead }

So wouldnt you just find the emote or GFX, whichever your looking for, and add a couple lines of code in your NPCHandler, Rather then the client?

Read full topic

item.title: Please answer these noob questions..I really need some help here
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

You need to find the correct GFX number for the dragon. I suggest you turn into a dragon, “::Pnpc (dragonIDhere)” and keep doing ::emote (next number up) till the dragon does the defence emote. For example…

::emote 1
::emote 2
::emote 3
::emote 4

And continue that pattern till you get to a number which the dragon (you) does the defence emote, or whatever emote you want it to do correctly.

Read full topic
